The Blue Angels
IMAX® 3D | Documentary
Showtimes
Educator Guide
The Blue Angels have been enthralling people across the country and around the globe for more than 75 years. Now IMAX Entertainment proudly presents a thrilling new abridged version of the documentary “The Blue Angels” taking audiences soaring with the Navy’s elite Flight Demonstration Squadron in breathtaking IMAX 2D & 3D presentations. Filmed for IMAX, the immersive footage puts you in the cockpit for a firsthand view of the Blue Angels’ precision flying, while the aerial shots deliver a spectacular showcase of the breathtaking maneuvers that have made them the world’s premier jet team. The Blue Angels also takes audiences behind the scenes for a revealing, in-depth look at what it takes to become a Blue Angel—from the careful selection process to the challenging training regimen, and on through the demanding eight-month show season. The film is a fitting tribute to the extraordinary teamwork, passion and pride of the hundreds of
outstanding men and women of the Navy and Marine Corps who have had the honor to serve in the Blue Angels squadron…past, present, and future.
Film Details
Run time: 40 minutes
Rating: G
Format: 3D
This program sponsored in part through COCA’s Cultural Grant Program funded by the City of Tallahassee and Leon County.
Your ticket purchase supports the Challenger Learning Center’s community outreach and educational programming.

Events and Programs
The Challenger Learning Center offers a variety of programs and events for families to enjoy while spending quality time together. Events are FREE unless otherwise noted ($)
Community Resources

Testimonials
I hope you will continue to support these kinds of educational programs as they are exactly the kinds of things that will help make Tallahassee the smartest city in Florida.
Steven J. Vancore
Our family has been a member of the Challenger Learning Center since 2013 and we have enjoyed many programs: planetarium shows, IMAX documentaries, SCIturdays and members-only special events offered by the wonderful staff at Challenger. We are proud supporters of the Challenger mission…Being a member of Challenger has had a positive impact on our family…We plan to renew our membership and continue supporting the Challenger Learning Center’s initiatives. We are excited to see what they do next.
Russ & Ruchi Rhodes
We have enjoyed working with the CLC over the last fourteen (14) years. We include a visit to the Challenger Learning Center for many of our groups booking a trip to the Tallahassee area. Your programs are educational and fun for the many students we serve each year.
Marta Kendall
Tour Coordinator
,
Sonshine Educational Tours, Coral Springs, FL
I’m a retired middle school science teacher and I am happy to report that I took my 6th grade students to “fly a mission” for many, many years, where they simulated being an astronaut… The Challenger Learning Center also offers many workshops for enrichment. Among my favorite ones tied literature with science… The CLC is unique and a definite asset to our community. My family and I will continue to support their programs and mission.
Irene Klay
I visit the Challenger Learning Center on a regular basis. The CLC has provided learning opportunities designed for all ages, not only K-12 students. I am a member of the Tallahassee Astronomical Society and consistently attend the free showing of Monthly Skies Over Tallahassee. We are lucky to have access to such a fine planetarium in the Tallahassee community. The CLC is an asset to our community and provides unique programming. I will continue to support their programs and overall mission.
Dayle Coxen
The Challenger Learning Center has opened up the universe for people of all abilities. As Executive Director of the Florida Disabled Outdoors Association, I want to let you know that our members are always welcomed at the many programs they have attended. The Challenger Learning Center is an asset to our community and provides unique programming. I will continue to support their programs and mission.
Laurie LoRe-Gussak
Executive Director
,
Florida Disabled Outdoors Association
Educator Testimonials
Testimonials are received through customer surveys following programming.
The Challenger Center always provides a highly engaging experience for the kids! Additionally, they are well organized and make the process of bringing the kids there very simple!
The Center provides engaging, relevant, and lasting learning experiences for students of all ages. Allowing students to connect to the history of the space program by learning about the Challenger experience and about our universe at large, leaves a lasting learning experience for children who may otherwise not encounter this information in the classroom.
The children are always engaged and learning. The staff is very easy to work with. It is a wonderful experience for everyone involved!
Challenger Learning Center is a great place to inspire students and open their minds about various science topics.
Not only did [our field trip] meet all of our Florida standards, but it also brought the abstract world of our universe into the hands of our students. They were able to almost touch and feel what it is really like in outer space.
The mission [simulation] gives every student the opportunity to be successful. Even the students least likely to participate get excited and understand their part in making the mission successful.
The staff is friendly, very accommodating, and encouraging to our students.
[The field trip] has always been a great experience, from the planning staff to the people that greet you when you walk in.
Wonderful facility, amazing films and excellent customer service. What more could we want?
Our trip to the CLC was one of the most engaging field trips that my students have ever participated in. Students were engaged in hands-on learning disguised as fun. In addition, the content was tightly correlated to eight grade science standards, providing a concrete shared experience to later serve as a launching point for mental reference.
The students enjoyed themselves. We have a great experience each year. This is the fifth year I have been planning field trips for Pre-K and the CLC is always first on my list.
My students loved [our field trip] and it sparked their interest in science. That’s all they can talk about.
Testimonials
Educator Testimonials
Testimonials are received through customer surveys following programming.

Job Openings
The Challenger Learning Center of Tallahassee (CLC) is the K-12 outreach facility of the Florida A&M University – Florida State University College of Engineering. All part-time employees are hired as official Florida State University staff. Explore our current job openings below and submit your application using the provided form.
Apply Now
All open positions are currently PART TIME only.
Education Staff
Do you love inspiring young minds through science, technology, engineering, arts, and math? As Education Staff at the Challenger Learning Center, you’ll engage students in hands-on, interactive learning experiences that spark curiosity and creativity. In this dynamic role, you’ll help deliver exciting educational programs, guide students, and foster a love for STEAM subjects. If you thrive in an interactive, fast-paced environment and want to make a lasting impact on future innovators, this is the position for you!
Learn More & Apply
Flight Director
Guide students on an out-of-this-world mission! As a Flight Director, you’ll lead simulated space missions, immerse students in hands-on problem-solving, and create an unforgettable learning experience. This role is perfect for those who thrive in an exciting, fast-paced environment and love inspiring the next generation of explorers.
Learn More & Apply
Planetarium Operator – E
vening/Weekend Shift
Take audiences on a journey through the cosmos! As a Planetarium Operator, you’ll run breathtaking astronomy shows, operate cutting-edge projection systems, and educate visitors about the wonders of the universe. If you have a passion for space and technology, this is the role for you.
Learn More & Apply
Host Staff
Be the face of fun and discovery! As part of our Host Staff team, you’ll welcome guests, assist with ticketing and concessions, and help create a memorable experience at the Challenger Learning Center. If you have great customer service skills and love working in an energetic environment, we want to hear from you.
Learn More & Apply
Host Staff Shift Lead
Take the lead in creating a stellar visitor experience! As a Shift Lead, you’ll oversee daily operations, support team members, and ensure guests have an amazing time at the Challenger Learning Center. This role is perfect for those with leadership skills and a passion for guest services.
Learn More & Apply
“If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together.”

By becoming a Challenger Learning Center member, you can take advantage of discounts on children’s camps, invitations to members-only events, free admission to participating
Association of Science and Technology Center museums and institutions
, and much, much more!
Purchase a Membership

How to Become a Member: Online
Purchase a membership online
Your membership package will be mailed to you within 7 business days
How to Become a Member: Paper Application
Download and complete the membership registration form
(one per membership).
Submit the completed form to us via mail,
email
, fax, or drop off a copy to our administrative suite at 200 S. Duval St.
Submit payment. We accept cash, check, Visa, Mastercard, Discover, FSU Card and American Express. You may come by our administrative suite to drop off a check or cash, mail a check, or call our sales coordinator with your credit card information. Please do not email or fax credit card numbers to the Challenger Learning Center.
After payment has been received, your membership package will be mailed to you within 7 business days.
For more information, please contact our membership coordinator
by email
or 850.645.7777. You may also view our
frequently asked questions
regarding memberships.
